thread.title: No job is too odd for the TaskRabbits
thread.title_full: No job is too odd for the TaskRabbits

title: No job is too odd for the TaskRabbits
text:
James Dean Technology Correspondent Last updated   
Being first in line to get theatre tickets for an otherwise sold-out show or to eat in the trendy pop-up restaurant around the corner no longer means hours spent queuing. A growing army of helpers is on hand to stand in line for you — for a fee. 
They will also assemble your flat-pack furniture, dig weeds out of your garden and, if need be, scuba dive to the bottom of a lake to search for lost keys. 
These helpers, or “taskers”, are members of TaskRabbit, an online odd-jobs marketplace that is becoming increasingly popular. The scope of their tasks is Subscribe now
